ray.rage.rendersystem

Interface Renderable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ManualObjectSection, SubEntity, TessellationBody
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGenericRenderable, GenericManualObjectSection, GenericSubEntity, GenericTessellationBody

    public interface Renderable
extends Disposable
    A renderable is a discrete object that can be rendered by a render-system. It's not meant for terrains and other kinds of "static" geometry.

    Any object meant to be processed and rendered by a render-system must itself be renderable.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Renderable.DataSource
      Specifies whether the render-system should use data from a vertex buffer or an index buffer for drawing operations.
      static class  Renderable.Primitive
      The primitives to be used by the render-system to render this renderable.

      • getVertexBuffer

        java.nio.FloatBuffer getVertexBuffer()
        Gets this renderable's vertex positions buffer.

        Vertex positions define the renderable's actual geometric shape relative to an arbitrary origin in local/object-space.

        Returns:
        The vertex positions buffer.

      • getTextureCoordsBuffer

        java.nio.FloatBuffer getTextureCoordsBuffer()
        Gets this renderable's vertex texture coordinates buffer.

        Texture coordinates specify which section of a texture should be sampled to determine a fragment's color.

        Returns:
        The vertex texture coordinates buffer.

      • getNormalsBuffer

        java.nio.FloatBuffer getNormalsBuffer()
        Gets this renderable's vertex normals buffer.

        Vertex normals are perpendicular to a primitive's surface and are necessary for lighting effects.

        Returns:
        The vertex normals buffer.

      • getIndexBuffer

        java.nio.IntBuffer getIndexBuffer()
        Gets this renderable's vertex index buffer.

        Vertex indices are used to "point to" specific vertex positions when processing geometry that has been specified with index data.

        Returns:
        The vertex index buffer.

      • getBoneWeightBuffer

        java.nio.FloatBuffer getBoneWeightBuffer()
        Gets this renderable's bone weight buffer.

        Bone weights are used to specify how much a vertex's position is affected by a particular bone.

        Returns:
        The bone weight buffer.

      • getBoneIndexBuffer

        java.nio.FloatBuffer getBoneIndexBuffer()
        Gets this renderable's bone index buffer.

        Bone indices are used to "point to" specific bones in a skeleton for the vertices to be modified by that specific bone. This also utilizes the boneWeightBuffer for specifying how much the vertex's position is modified by said bone.

        Returns:
        The bone index buffer.

      • setPoseSkinMatrices

        Sets the pose Skinning Matrices that should be used for this renderable.
        Parameters:
        psm - Array of Matrix4 to use.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the array is null.

      • getPoseSkinMatrices

        Gets the pose Skin Matrices Array specified for this renderable, if any.
        Returns:
        The array of skinning matrices, if set. Otherwise null.

        Parameters:
        psmIT - Array of Matrix3 to use.

        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the array is null.

      • setGpuShaderProgram

        void setGpuShaderProgram(GpuShaderProgram prog)
        Sets the shader-program the render-system must use to draw this renderable.

        Note that renderables cannot be processed unless it has an associated shader-program.

        Parameters:
        prog - The shader-program.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the shader-program is null.

      • getGpuShaderProgram

        GpuShaderProgram getGpuShaderProgram()
        Gets the shader-program currently assigned to this renderable. Otherwise null.
        Returns:
        The shader-program.

      • setRenderState

        void setRenderState(RenderState state)
        Sets a render-state that will be applied to the render-system before attempting to render this renderable.

        A single renderable can have multiple render-states simultaneously, as long as they're of different types. Setting a different instance of the same type causes the previous instance to be disposed and overwritten/replaced.

        Note that renderables may not be rendered correctly unless an appropriate render-state has been added.

        Parameters:
        state - The render-state to be added or replaced.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the render-state is null.

      • getRenderState

        RenderState getRenderState(RenderState.Type type)
        Gets a render-state of the specified type, if one has already been set. Otherwise null.

        It's the client's responsibility to cast the returned instance into the proper type, if necessary.

        Parameters:
        type - The type.
        Returns:
        The render-state, if one is found. Otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the type is null.

      • getRenderStates

        java.lang.Iterable<RenderState> getRenderStates()
        Allows clients to iterate over all the render-states that have been added to this.
        Returns:
        An iterable of render-states.

      • clearRenderState

        void clearRenderState(RenderState.Type type)
        Removes and disposes of the render-state of the specified type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to be removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the type is null.

      • getWorldTransformMatrix

        Matrix4 getWorldTransformMatrix()
        Gets the world-space transform matrix of this renderable.
        Returns:
        The world-space transform matrix.
